instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1708 820-00840-A with only 5V on ampmeter.

UPC_XB_SPI_CLK has only 0.120 on diode reading, and comparing it with other board, it seams to be low.

Should I replace U3200?

Can you help?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message: Remove R3090 and check where the low reading remains.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
It was on TBT_X_SPI_CLK, and after replacing U2890 the diode readiing on TBT_X_SPI_CLK went back yo 0.605, and UPC_XB_SPI_CLK to 0.669.

UPC_XB_SPI_MISO went to 0.055 on diode reading. Can [U]U2890 be bad? How can i be sure?[/U]

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
Then the problem comes from U2800, or U2890.
Be sure no corrosion between J3098 pads.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message: Replaced U2890 again, and now UPC_XB_SPI_MISO went back to 0.650 on diode reading, but still 5V only on ampmeter.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
It was R3205. I was 0.505 on diode reading, and it should be 0.650. Afetr replaced it, it started to work again.

TKS

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
It was R3205. It was 0.505 on diode reading, and it should be 0.740. After replaced it, it started to go to 20V, but only one time.

Now it is with 5V again...

Any idea?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
Client said it closed it one night, and in the morning it didn't start again.

However, it had oxidation signs on the backlight area, and client said it was two years ago, and it was repaired then (can't see nothing shorted there, except some caps a bit darker, but with normal diode readings).

Now, I've replaced U2890 for 3 times, and they only work on the first power on. Something is killing U2890, but I can't understand what it is.

Any idea?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no power
threads.message:
Impossible to kill TBT ROM, if its power is correct.
Be sure adjacent resistors have good ohm value.
U2800 may have accumulated crap underneath, or internal problems; it connects with U2890 too.
Try to reball/replace it.
